data.title: Shrimp and Grits!
data.text: The shrimp and grits are awesome! Couple it with their drink selection and you are good to go! Eat in the main room for lively evening, or the Oak Room for quieter conversation.

data.title: Nice place for a drink and appetizers!
data.text: I recently tried Union for lunch the other day with my boyfriend.  We were driving down the coast and decided to stop in.  I had been before and didn't love the vibe but thought I would give it another chance.  I still felt the same this time around.  The restaurant was not busy and we were seated right away.  We were seated by the window which was great but on the other side of the bar by ourselves.  It took 15 minutes before we flagged someone down to take our drink and food order.  We ended up flagging over a busboy who was nice enough to help take our order.  He missed a few things but he tried.  The server eventually came by to deliver our drinks and she was nice but it just seemed slow.  The food was good and I do recommend the Union burger.  It was cooked very well and the tomato jam was very good on it.  I do like the openness of the restaurant in the front but the rest of it seems a bit dark to me.  It's a nice place to stop in for a drink or apps if you are driving down the coast.

data.title: Great Casual Dining
data.text:
My husband and I visited this restaurant for dinner with a local friend, and it was a great experience.  The atmosphere is warm and pretty loud, very casual, and friendly.  The menu was outstanding with some unique and interesting items.

We shared the poutine which was a diet different than the Canadian classic but was still amazingly good.  We then shared the scallops which were also very good.

The drink list was great, and the service was outstanding - timely, friendly, easy-going.

This is a place that I would love to visit again, and I highly recommend it.

data.title: Yum, Yum, Yum!
data.text: When we first walked in it was extremely loud but we were seated in the dining room and it was much better. Service was excellent, attentive but not over bearing. The food was fabulous. We had looked at menu online ( it was clearly a fall menu) and had all had an idea in mind but realized when we got there it was still the summer menu. After a few minutes new choices were made. We started with the cheddar chive mini biscuits which were great. As entrées we had the Asparagus and chickpea risotto, blackened pork rack and the union burger as well as a side if grilled brussel sprouts. Everything was cooked to perfection with excellent flavor. Portion size was appropriate for price. I would highly recommend this restaurant and only wish we had locations in Florida.

data.title: High energy good food and craft beers
data.text: Stopped in for a late lunch on a Sunday after a hike in Torrey Pines. Lots of football on several TVs but easily ignored if you're not into football. Very busy but a fun crowd. All ages but mostly 20-30 somethings. The bartender was not particularly engaged but once we got a table Nick, our server was awesome! Attentive but not in your face. Never felt rushed. When the bar ran out of the Artifex I was drinking, Nick brought me two tastes of alternate selections to choose from. Now that's service I appreciated! Food was okay. My husband liked the bison burger. The fries were like the end of the batch tho. Just bits and pieces. I had chicken & waffles. Overall decent but the chicken just a bit dry and the waffle just a bit under-cooked. A fun place and we will be back. Love the open air front and the overall vibe.

data.title: Camping trip lunch
data.text: Stopped in for lunch after a walk into Encinitas from San Elijo SB campground. I had the buffalo burger with fries which was excellent. My wife had the fish and chips which was also excellent. The restaurant has a great sports bar feel. The service was excellent. We will go back next time we in that area.

data.title: Great Casual Dining
data.text: Union has a classic sports bar feel with a nice upscale atmosphere. Nice menu with many great tasting choices and a nice wine and beer selection. We were very pleased and would go back in a heart beat.

data.title: Beer+Foodie heaven
data.text: My husband chooses restaurants largely based on the quality of their craft beer taps while I love a nice hoppy IPA, I'm looking for a great menu and cool vibe to round out the choice.  Union Kitchen and Tap room delivers the full meal deal.  Lots of beer options including 10 rotating taps , very cool rustic industrial decor and great interesting food options.  I love the shrimp and grits, the just-right-spicy gumbo, and the watermelon arugula salad but really I always have trouble deciding because there are so many other tempting options.  Oh, and they have long happy hours!  Lots of open seating in the bar, but it can get noisy because this place is so popular.  My top pick for dinner in Encinitas.

data.title: Burgers and Beer
data.text: So much more but the burgers and beer are so great!  It's a small place and always packed so you'll have to shout to be heard!  The food is awesome!

data.title: The KC Style Beef Belly may be better than home. I'm from KC, Texas and Australia, I know BBQ and this is soo good I buy
data.text: The KC Style Beef Belly may be better than home. I'm from KC, Texas and Australia, I know BBQ and this is soo good I buy it by the pound! Friends and family expect me to provide awesome BBQ, but who has time to smoke beef for 14-18 hours. 'BUY IT AND LIE ABOUT IT!' THX Kim and Abel

data.title: Good food and beverages
data.text:
Late afternoon, enjoyed our salads and small plates (which were actually incredibly generous).  The poke was amazing!  My husband loved his flatbread, and I loved the kale salad.  We did not feel at all rushed, even when they got busier later on.  
As we slid from the happy hour into the dinner hour, the rest of our family came from the beach to join us, and the server accommodated our combined party attentively.  All liked their foods!  The fig/goat cheese flatbread for our group was a hit, as were the fries (and everything else).  Beers were varied and all good -- then the group enjoyed the various mules.  Nicest staff - even turned down the sound when we first arrived for us.  
We had a great time!

data.title: Consistently delicious
data.text: Every time we visit Encinitas we eat here and I have never been disappointed. The flatbread is fantastic, same for beet salad and if you've never tried Okra, go ahead and give it s try- it's surprisingly delicious

data.title: Try a beetnik
data.text:
We were here on their taco Tuesday. I tried one of each, steak, chicken and crawfish. They were all amazingly tasty and cooked to perfection. The crawfish taco was my favorite. 
If you go try the 'Beetnik', a cocktail made of beet juice, basil, ginger, cucumber and gin. It was so refreshing on a warm humid day. 
Great service, great food and great drinks

data.title: Fun night out great location
data.text: Had dinner here in Aug 2016, great atmosphere & the food was excellent. Very busy but a lively/enjoyable crowd. Good choice of beers. I had beef tacos, wings & a brilliant steak. Highly recommended. Encinitas is such a cool place too.

data.title: Bar with good food
data.text:
Union is sort of a sports bar, with a multitude of TVs tuned to various sporting events, even horse racing at the nearby Del Mar Turf Club.

But the real reason to come here is for the food. Outstanding shrimp and grits, pretty good burgers, and interesting flatbreads. I came with a group and everyone proclaimed their meal to be tasty. Sadly, my flatbread, while pretty good, was cold, but I could see steam rising off the entrees of other members of my group, so I guess mine was an outlier.

Their beer selection is very good, with local beers, and a rotating selection of beers on tap.

data.title: Pretty happy about my chicken and waffles and Bloody Mary
data.text: Maybe it doesn’t take much to please me, but give me a spicy Bloody Mary and delicious fried chicken breast with tasty waffles and I am smiling.  My friend who had the burger thought it was one of the best he has had.  It is just off the center of down town but Encinitas is not that long.  It is closer to Deepak’s meditation grounds.   The service was good and if you get in the main dining area the windows will be open and you should get a nice breeze.  We did not want to wait so we were in a quieter back room.

data.title: Really good hamburger!
data.text: I read they had one of the best burgers so we decided to try...it was awesome! They make their own tomato "jam" which is so good! A friend, who owns a restaurant, once told me she always checked the restroom before she ate some where because if the bathroom is clean then there's a good chance the kitchen is clean...thus the picture of the bathroom!  It was clean!

data.title: Great staff, okay food.
data.text: The bad: music was some type of dub step. I almost left cause I found it kind of annoying. The average: burger was cooked well, but unremarkable. Brussel sprouts were tiny and kinda flavourless. The good: the bar staff was really great. Super nice and very helpful.

data.title: GOOD RESTAURANT AND BAR ON HIGHWAY 101 IN ENCINITAS
data.text: The Union Kitchen and Tap is located on the West side of Highway 101 in Southern Encinitas. There are lots of tables and a bar and televisions viewable from most areas. They have an interesting menu with brunch served on weekends featuring bottomless mimosas. We were there for brunch on a Saturday and the food and service was good.

data.title: Neat, frinedly casual with Great Craft Beer Selection
data.text: Met a frined who took us to lunch and enjoyed everything about the place. We are regular annual tourists and Union will be added to our list. Friendly server , menu with great variety and good beach bar environment,
